question: Why is my payment failing?
answer: Payment failures can be due to: 1) Insufficient funds - check account balance. 2) Expired card - update card details. 3) Incorrect CVV or billing address. 4) Bank blocking international transactions - contact your bank. 5) Daily spending limit reached. 6) Card reported lost/stolen. To fix: Update payment method in Settings > Billing. We retry failed payments 3 times over 7 days. After that, subscription suspends. Reactivate within 30 days to avoid data loss.

To fix: Update payment method in Settings > Billing. We retry failed payments 3 times over 7 days. After that, subscription suspends. Reactivate within 30 days to avoid data loss.

question: How do I reset my password?
answer: To reset your password: 1) Click 'Forgot Password' on login page. 2) Enter your registered email. 3) Check email for reset link (check spam folder). 4) Link expires in 1 hour. 5) Click link and create new password. 6) Password requirements: 8+ characters, 1 uppercase, 1 number, 1 special character. 7) Confirm new password. 8) You'll be logged out of all devices. 9) Log back in with new password. If no email received, check email address is correct or contact support.

question: How do I delete my account?
answer: Account deletion is permanent: 1) Settings > Account > Delete Account. 2) Review what will be deleted (all data, subscriptions canceled). 3) Export your data first if needed. 4) Enter password to confirm. 5) Check 'I understand this is permanent'. 6) Click 'Delete My Account'. 7) Confirmation email sent. 8) 30-day grace period - you can cancel deletion. 9) After 30 days, all data permanently deleted. Active subscriptions are canceled. No refunds for remaining time. Cannot create new account with same email for 90 days.

question: Why does my app keep crashing?
answer: App crashes can be caused by several factors: 1) Outdated app version - Update to the latest version from the app store. 2) Low device storage - Clear cache and free up at least 500MB. 3) Conflicting apps - Close background apps. 4) Corrupted data - Try clearing app data in Settings > Apps. 5) Device compatibility - Check minimum requirements. If the issue persists after trying these steps, please contact support with your device model and OS version.
text:
Q: Why does my app keep crashing?
A: App crashes can be caused by several factors: 1) Outdated app version - Update to the latest version from the app store. 2) Low device storage - Clear cache and free up at least 500MB. 3) Conflicting apps - Close background apps. 4) Corrupted data - Try clearing app data in Settings > Apps. 5) Device compatibility - Check minimum requirements. If the issue persists after trying these steps, please contact support with your device model and OS version.

question: How do I fix login issues?
answer: To resolve login problems: 1) Verify your email and password are correct. 2) Clear browser cache and cookies. 3) Try a different browser or incognito mode. 4) Disable browser extensions temporarily. 5) Check if Caps Lock is on. 6) Reset your password if needed. 7) Ensure your account isn't locked (check your email for notifications). If you still can't log in, contact support with your registered email address.

If you still can't log in, contact support with your registered email address.

question: My data isn't syncing across devices
answer: For sync issues: 1) Ensure you're logged into the same account on all devices. 2) Check your internet connection. 3) Verify sync is enabled in Settings > Sync. 4) Force sync by pulling down to refresh. 5) Log out and log back in on the affected device. 6) Update the app to the latest version. 7) Check if you have sufficient cloud storage. Sync typically takes 1-5 minutes depending on data size.

question: How do I export my data?
answer: To export your data: 1) Go to Settings > Data Export. 2) Select the data type (all data, specific categories, or date range). 3) Choose export format (CSV, JSON, or PDF). 4) Click 'Export Data'. 5) You'll receive a download link via email within 24 hours. 6) The link expires in 7 days. For large datasets (>5GB), export may take up to 48 hours. You can export data once every 30 days.

question: The app is running very slow
answer: To improve app performance: 1) Close other running apps to free up memory. 2) Clear app cache: Settings > Apps > [App Name] > Clear Cache. 3) Restart your device. 4) Update to the latest app version. 5) Check available storage (need at least 1GB free). 6) Disable animations in Settings if on an older device. 7) Check your internet speed (minimum 5 Mbps recommended). 8) Reduce background sync frequency in Settings.

question: How do I recover deleted items?
answer: To recover deleted items: 1) Check the Trash/Recycle Bin in the app (items kept for 30 days). 2) Go to Settings > Deleted Items. 3) Select items to restore. 4) Click 'Restore'. Items return to their original location. After 30 days, items are permanently deleted and cannot be recovered. For premium users, backup history extends to 90 days. Contact support within 24 hours of deletion for possible emergency recovery.

question: I'm getting error code 500
answer: Error 500 indicates a server issue: 1) This is usually temporary - wait 5-10 minutes and try again. 2) Check our status page at status.example.com for ongoing issues. 3) Clear browser cache and cookies. 4) Try a different network (switch from WiFi to mobile data). 5) If persists, it may be scheduled maintenance (check your email). Our team is automatically notified of 500 errors. For urgent issues, contact support with the exact error message and timestamp.

question: How do I enable two-factor authentication?
answer: To enable 2FA: 1) Go to Settings > Security > Two-Factor Authentication. 2) Click 'Enable 2FA'. 3) Choose your method: SMS, Authenticator App, or Email. 4) For Authenticator: Scan the QR code with Google Authenticator or Authy. 5) Enter the 6-digit code to verify. 6) Save your backup codes in a safe place. 7) You'll need to enter a code each time you log in from a new device. Highly recommended for security.

A: Yes! Discount programs: Students: 50% off with valid .edu email. Verify at example.com/student. Non-profits: 40% off with 501(c)(3) verification. Apply at example.com/nonprofit. question: How do I view my billing history?
answer: To access billing history: 1) Settings > Billing > Billing History. 2) View all transactions with dates and amounts. 3) Download invoices as PDF. 4) Filter by date range or transaction type. 5) Export all history as CSV. 6) Receipts auto-sent to email on file. 7) History available for past 7 years. For accounting purposes, invoices include: transaction ID, date, amount, payment method, tax breakdown. Customize invoice details in Settings > Billing > Invoice Settings.

For accounting purposes, invoices include: transaction ID, date, amount, payment method, tax breakdown. Customize invoice details in Settings > Billing > Invoice Settings.

question: Why is my payment failing?
answer: Payment failures can be due to: 1) Insufficient funds - check account balance. 2) Expired card - update card details. 3) Incorrect CVV or billing address. 4) Bank blocking international transactions - contact your bank. 5) Daily spending limit reached. 6) Card reported lost/stolen. To fix: Update payment method in Settings > Billing. We retry failed payments 3 times over 7 days. After that, subscription suspends. Reactivate within 30 days to avoid data loss.

question: How do I reset my password?
answer: To reset your password: 1) Click 'Forgot Password' on login page. 2) Enter your registered email. 3) Check email for reset link (check spam folder). 4) Link expires in 1 hour. 5) Click link and create new password. 6) Password requirements: 8+ characters, 1 uppercase, 1 number, 1 special character. 7) Confirm new password. 8) You'll be logged out of all devices. 9) Log back in with new password. If no email received, check email address is correct or contact support.

A: To reset your password: 1) Click 'Forgot Password' on login page. 2) Enter your registered email. 3) Check email for reset link (check spam folder). 4) Link expires in 1 hour. 5) Click link and create new password. 6) Password requirements: 8+ characters, 1 uppercase, 1 number, 1 special character. 7) Confirm new password. 8) You'll be logged out of all devices. 9) Log back in with new password. If no email received, check email address is correct or contact support.

question: How do I delete my account?
answer: Account deletion is permanent: 1) Settings > Account > Delete Account. 2) Review what will be deleted (all data, subscriptions canceled). 3) Export your data first if needed. 4) Enter password to confirm. 5) Check 'I understand this is permanent'. 6) Click 'Delete My Account'. 7) Confirmation email sent. 8) 30-day grace period - you can cancel deletion. 9) After 30 days, all data permanently deleted. Active subscriptions are canceled. No refunds for remaining time. Cannot create new account with same email for 90 days.

question: Can I change my email address?
answer: Yes, to change email: 1) Settings > Account > Email Address. 2) Enter new email. 3) Enter current password. 4) Verify new email (check inbox for verification link). 5) Click verification link within 24 hours. 6) Email updated after verification. 7) Login now uses new email. 8) All notifications sent to new address. Note: Cannot use email already associated with another account. Keep access to old email for 30 days in case of issues. Update email in app store subscription separately if applicable.

question: How do I merge duplicate accounts?
answer: To merge accounts: 1) Email support with both account emails. 2) Specify which account to keep (primary). 3) We'll send verification emails to both. 4) Confirm merge within 48 hours. 5) Data from secondary account moves to primary. 6) Secondary account deleted after merge. 7) Subscriptions: keep higher tier or most recent. 8) Process takes 2-5 business days. Cannot merge if different names/owners. Cannot undo after completion. Billing: active subscription transferred, prorated credit for duplicate.

question: How do I update my profile information?

question: Why does my app keep crashing?
answer: App crashes can be caused by several factors: 1) Outdated app version - Update to the latest version from the app store. 2) Low device storage - Clear cache and free up at least 500MB. 3) Conflicting apps - Close background apps. 4) Corrupted data - Try clearing app data in Settings > Apps. 5) Device compatibility - Check minimum requirements. If the issue persists after trying these steps, please contact support with your device model and OS version.
text:
Q: Why does my app keep crashing?
A: App crashes can be caused by several factors: 1) Outdated app version - Update to the latest version from the app store. 2) Low device storage - Clear cache and free up at least 500MB. 3) Conflicting apps - Close background apps. 4) Corrupted data - Try clearing app data in Settings > Apps. 5) Device compatibility - Check minimum requirements. If the issue persists after trying these steps, please contact support with your device model and OS version.

question: How do I fix login issues?
answer: To resolve login problems: 1) Verify your email and password are correct. 2) Clear browser cache and cookies. 3) Try a different browser or incognito mode. 4) Disable browser extensions temporarily. 5) Check if Caps Lock is on. 6) Reset your password if needed. 7) Ensure your account isn't locked (check your email for notifications). If you still can't log in, contact support with your registered email address.
text:
Q: How do I fix login issues?
A: To resolve login problems: 1) Verify your email and password are correct. 2) Clear browser cache and cookies. 3) Try a different browser or incognito mode. 4) Disable browser extensions temporarily. 5) Check if Caps Lock is on. 6) Reset your password if needed. 7) Ensure your account isn't locked (check your email for notifications). If you still can't log in, contact support with your registered email address.

question: My data isn't syncing across devices
answer: For sync issues: 1) Ensure you're logged into the same account on all devices. 2) Check your internet connection. 3) Verify sync is enabled in Settings > Sync. 4) Force sync by pulling down to refresh. 5) Log out and log back in on the affected device. 6) Update the app to the latest version. 7) Check if you have sufficient cloud storage. Sync typically takes 1-5 minutes depending on data size.

Sync typically takes 1-5 minutes depending on data size.

question: How do I export my data?
answer: To export your data: 1) Go to Settings > Data Export. 2) Select the data type (all data, specific categories, or date range). 3) Choose export format (CSV, JSON, or PDF). 4) Click 'Export Data'. 5) You'll receive a download link via email within 24 hours. 6) The link expires in 7 days. For large datasets (>5GB), export may take up to 48 hours. You can export data once every 30 days.

For large datasets (>5GB), export may take up to 48 hours. You can export data once every 30 days.

question: The app is running very slow
answer: To improve app performance: 1) Close other running apps to free up memory. 2) Clear app cache: Settings > Apps > [App Name] > Clear Cache. 3) Restart your device. 4) Update to the latest app version. 5) Check available storage (need at least 1GB free). 6) Disable animations in Settings if on an older device. 7) Check your internet speed (minimum 5 Mbps recommended). 8) Reduce background sync frequency in Settings.

question: How do I recover deleted items?
answer: To recover deleted items: 1) Check the Trash/Recycle Bin in the app (items kept for 30 days). 2) Go to Settings > Deleted Items. 3) Select items to restore. 4) Click 'Restore'. Items return to their original location. After 30 days, items are permanently deleted and cannot be recovered. For premium users, backup history extends to 90 days. Contact support within 24 hours of deletion for possible emergency recovery.

question: I'm getting error code 500
answer: Error 500 indicates a server issue: 1) This is usually temporary - wait 5-10 minutes and try again. 2) Check our status page at status.example.com for ongoing issues. 3) Clear browser cache and cookies. 4) Try a different network (switch from WiFi to mobile data). 5) If persists, it may be scheduled maintenance (check your email). Our team is automatically notified of 500 errors. For urgent issues, contact support with the exact error message and timestamp.

question: How do I enable two-factor authentication?
answer: To enable 2FA: 1) Go to Settings > Security > Two-Factor Authentication. 2) Click 'Enable 2FA'. 3) Choose your method: SMS, Authenticator App, or Email. 4) For Authenticator: Scan the QR code with Google Authenticator or Authy. 5) Enter the 6-digit code to verify. 6) Save your backup codes in a safe place. 7) You'll need to enter a code each time you log in from a new device. Highly recommended for security.

question: Can I use the app offline?
answer: Yes, limited offline functionality is available: 1) Downloaded content can be accessed offline. 2) Changes made offline sync when you reconnect. 3) To enable: Settings > Offline Mode > ON. 4) Download specific items by tapping the download icon. 5) Offline storage limit: Free (2GB), Premium (10GB), Enterprise (Unlimited). 6) Some features require internet: real-time collaboration, video streaming, and live updates. Last synced data shows timestamp.

question: Why was I charged twice this month?
answer: Double charges can occur due to: 1) Overlapping subscription cycles if you upgraded mid-month. 2) Payment method failure followed by successful retry. 3) Switching between monthly and annual plans. 4) App store charges plus our charges if subscribed through multiple platforms. Check your billing history in Settings > Billing. Duplicate charges are automatically refunded within 5-7 business days. If you see an unauthorized charge, contact support immediately with transaction ID and date.

question: How do I cancel my subscription?

answer: Payment failures can be due to: 1) Insufficient funds - check account balance. 2) Expired card - update card details. 3) Incorrect CVV or billing address. 4) Bank blocking international transactions - contact your bank. 5) Daily spending limit reached. 6) Card reported lost/stolen. To fix: Update payment method in Settings > Billing. We retry failed payments 3 times over 7 days. After that, subscription suspends. Reactivate within 30 days to avoid data loss.
text:
Q: Why is my payment failing?
A: Payment failures can be due to: 1) Insufficient funds - check account balance. 2) Expired card - update card details. 3) Incorrect CVV or billing address. 4) Bank blocking international transactions - contact your bank. 5) Daily spending limit reached. 6) Card reported lost/stolen. To fix: Update payment method in Settings > Billing. We retry failed payments 3 times over 7 days. After that, subscription suspends. Reactivate within 30 days to avoid data loss.

question: How do I reset my password?
answer: To reset your password: 1) Click 'Forgot Password' on login page. 2) Enter your registered email. 3) Check email for reset link (check spam folder). 4) Link expires in 1 hour. 5) Click link and create new password. 6) Password requirements: 8+ characters, 1 uppercase, 1 number, 1 special character. 7) Confirm new password. 8) You'll be logged out of all devices. 9) Log back in with new password. If no email received, check email address is correct or contact support.

If no email received, check email address is correct or contact support.

question: How do I delete my account?
answer: Account deletion is permanent: 1) Settings > Account > Delete Account. 2) Review what will be deleted (all data, subscriptions canceled). 3) Export your data first if needed. 4) Enter password to confirm. 5) Check 'I understand this is permanent'. 6) Click 'Delete My Account'. 7) Confirmation email sent. 8) 30-day grace period - you can cancel deletion. 9) After 30 days, all data permanently deleted. Active subscriptions are canceled. No refunds for remaining time. Cannot create new account with same email for 90 days.

question: How do I apply for an internal position?
answer: To apply for internal positions: 1) Visit the internal job portal at careers.company.com/internal. 2) Log in with your employee credentials. 3) Browse open positions or search by department/keyword. 4) Click 'Apply' on positions of interest. 5) Update your internal resume if needed. 6) Complete the application form and submit. 7) Notify your current manager (required after submitting). 8) HR will review within 5 business days. 9) You must have been in current role for at least 12 months. 10) Internal candidates receive priority consideration and interview feedback within 2 weeks.

question: What is the typical interview process timeline?
answer: Our interview process typically follows this timeline: 1) Application Review: 3-5 business days. 2) Phone Screen: 30 minutes with HR recruiter, scheduled within 1 week. 3) Technical/Skills Assessment: 1-2 hours, completed within 1 week. 4) First Round Interview: 1 hour with hiring manager, within 1-2 weeks. 5) Second Round: Panel interview with team members (1-2 hours), within 1 week. 6) Final Interview: 30-45 minutes with department head. 7) Offer Decision: 3-5 business days after final interview. Total timeline: 3-6 weeks from application to offer. We provide updates at each stage.

question: What are the candidate screening criteria?
answer: We evaluate candidates on: 1) Required Qualifications: Education, certifications, years of experience as listed in job description. 2) Skills Match: Technical skills, software proficiency, industry knowledge (must meet 80%+ of requirements). 3) Cultural Fit: Alignment with company values, teamwork, communication skills. 4) Portfolio/Work Samples: For applicable roles. 5) References: Professional references (minimum 2). 6) Background Check: Conducted after conditional offer. 7) Assessment Scores: Technical tests, personality assessments where applicable. Priority given to: internal candidates, employee referrals, diverse candidates. All candidates receive equal consideration regardless of age, gender, race, or background.

question: Can I refer someone for a position?
answer: Yes! Our employee referral program: 1) Log in to careers.company.com/referral. 2) Enter referral's name, email, and position they're suited for. 3) Add a brief recommendation (why they're a good fit). 4) Referral receives priority screening. 5) You'll be notified at each stage of their application. 6) Referral Bonus: $2,000 for most positions (paid after 90 days of employment), $5,000 for hard-to-fill senior roles. 7) Referrals hired have 25% higher retention rate. 8) No limit on number of referrals. 9) Cannot refer immediate family members. 10) Track your referrals in the portal dashboard.

question: What happens after I receive a job offer?
answer: After receiving an offer: 1) Offer Letter: Contains position details, salary, start date, benefits summary. 2) Response Deadline: You have 5 business days to accept, decline, or negotiate. 3) Negotiation: You may discuss salary, start date, or benefits with HR. 4) Acceptance: Sign and return offer letter via DocuSign. 5) Background Check: Completed within 3-5 days (employment verification, criminal check, education verification). 6) Pre-boarding: Receive welcome packet, IT setup form, and first-day details. 7) Onboarding Documents: I-9, W-4, direct deposit, benefits enrollment (complete before start date). 8) Start Date: Typically 2-4 weeks from offer acceptance. Offer contingent on successful background check and reference verification.

question: How long do you keep applications on file?
answer: Application retention policy: 1) Active Applications: Kept for duration of hiring process. 2) Unsuccessful Applications: Retained for 12 months in our talent pool. 3) You may be considered for future positions matching your profile. 4) Update Your Profile: Log in to careers portal to update resume/information anytime. 5) Auto-Apply for Future Roles: Opt-in to be auto-considered for similar positions. 6) After 12 months: Application archived unless you reapply. 7) Reapplication: You can reapply immediately for different positions or after 6 months for the same position. 8) Data Privacy: Applications handled per GDPR/privacy laws. Request deletion at privacy@company.com.

question: What benefits are offered to new hires?

question: Do you sponsor work visas?
answer: Visa sponsorship policy: 1) H-1B Visa: Yes, we sponsor for specialized positions requiring bachelor's degree or higher. 2) Eligible Roles: Engineering, IT, Finance, specialized professional roles. 3) Requirements: Position must meet prevailing wage requirements, candidate must have qualifying degree/experience. 4) Process: Candidate must be available to start work authorization process, lottery-based (filing in March). 5) Other Visas: We support OPT, OPT STEM extensions, and green card sponsorship for long-term employees. 6) Transfer H-1B: We accept transfers if you currently have valid H-1B with another employer. 7) Timeline: 3-6 months for H-1B processing. 8) Cost: Company covers legal and filing fees. Contact immigration@company.com for specific questions. Not all positions eligible.

question: When is payday?
answer: Payroll schedule: 1) Pay Frequency: Bi-weekly (every other Friday). 2) Total Pay Periods: 26 per year. 3) Direct Deposit: Funds available by 9 AM EST on payday. 4) Paper Check: Available for pickup after 12 PM (must opt-in via Payroll portal). 5) Pay Period: Covers previous 2 weeks (Monday-Sunday). 6) First Paycheck: May be prorated based on start date, typically 2-3 weeks after hire. 7) Holidays: If payday falls on holiday, payment made on last business day before. 8) View Pay Schedule: Check payroll.company.com for full year calendar. 9) Time Entry Deadline: Submit time by Tuesday 5 PM for current pay period. 10) Questions: Contact payroll@company.com or call ext. 2200.

question: How do I read my pay slip?
answer: Understanding your pay slip: 1) Gross Pay: Total earnings before deductions (regular hours + overtime + bonuses). 2) Federal Income Tax: Based on W-4 withholdings. 3) State Income Tax: Based on state residency. 4) FICA: Social Security (6.2%) + Medicare (1.45%). 5) Retirement: 401(k) contributions (pre-tax). 6) Health Insurance: Medical, dental, vision premiums (pre-tax). 7) Other Deductions: FSA, HSA, life insurance, disability. 8) Net Pay: Take-home amount after all deductions. 9) YTD Columns: Year-to-date totals for tax purposes. 10) PTO Balance: Current vacation/sick leave available. Access detailed breakdown at payroll.company.com. Download pay stubs anytime. Questions? Contact payroll@company.com.

question: How do I update my tax withholdings?
answer: To change tax withholdings: 1) Log in to payroll.company.com. 2) Go to 'Tax Information' section. 3) Click 'Update W-4'. 4) Complete new IRS W-4 form online. 5) Adjust: Filing status, dependents, additional withholding amount. 6) Submit electronically. 7) Changes effective next pay period (2 weeks). 8) Verify changes on next pay stub. 9) Update state withholdings separately if applicable. 10) Use IRS Withholding Calculator at irs.gov/w4app to determine correct withholdings. Important: Update after life changes (marriage, children, second job). Too little withheld = tax owed in April. Too much = smaller paycheck but refund later. Contact payroll for questions.

question: When will I receive my W-2 form?
answer: W-2 distribution: 1) Mailing Date: January 31st each year (federal deadline). 2) Electronic W-2: Available in payroll portal by January 25th. 3) Paper W-2: Mailed to address on file, allow 7-10 business days for delivery. 4) Opt-In to Electronic: Go to payroll.company.com > Tax Documents > E-Delivery Consent. 5) Update Address: Ensure correct address by December 31st for timely delivery. 6) Lost W-2: Request reprint after February 15th if not received. 7) Reprint Fee: $15 for paper copy, free electronic copy. 8) Former Employees: Mailed to last known address. Update address at payroll@company.com. 9) Access: W-2s available in portal for 7 years. 10) Questions: Contact payroll@company.com after February 1st.

question: How do I set up or change direct deposit?
answer: Direct deposit setup/changes: 1) Log in to payroll.company.com. 2) Navigate to 'Direct Deposit' section. 3) Click 'Add Bank Account'. 4) Enter: Bank name, routing number (9 digits), account number, account type (checking/savings). 5) Upload voided check or bank letter for verification. 6) Verify with micro-deposits (2 small deposits within 2-3 business days). 7) Once verified, set as primary account. 8) Split Deposits: Allocate percentage or fixed amount to multiple accounts (up to 3). 9) Changes effective 2 pay periods after verification. 10) Your last paycheck to old method, then switches. Keep old account open through transition. Paper check available if needed during setup. Questions: payroll@company.com or ext. 2200.

question: What should I do if my paycheck is incorrect?
answer: If you notice payroll errors: 1) Act Quickly: Report within 5 business days of payday. 2) Contact Payroll: Email payroll@company.com with: your employee ID, pay period dates, specific discrepancy description, correct amount. 3) Common Errors: Missing hours, incorrect overtime calculation, wrong deduction amounts, missing bonus/commission. 4) Documentation: Attach time sheets, overtime approvals, or relevant emails. 5) Investigation: Payroll investigates within 2 business days. 6) Correction: If error confirmed, adjustment made on next regular paycheck or special check issued if over $500. 7) Off-Cycle Check: For large errors affecting bills, request emergency payment (requires manager approval). 8) Underpayment: Corrected with interest if company error. 9) Overpayment: Repayment plan established if amount is significant. Always verify each pay stub carefully.

question: How is overtime calculated?
answer: Overtime calculation policy: 1) Eligibility: Non-exempt employees (hourly workers) - exempt employees (salaried) not eligible. 2) Overtime Rate: 1.5x regular hourly rate. 3) Threshold: Hours worked over 40 in a workweek (Sunday-Saturday). 4) Example: Regular rate $20/hr  Overtime rate $30/hr. 5) Daily Overtime: Some states require OT after 8 hours/day - check your state. 6) Double Time: 2x rate for work over 12 hours in a day or 7th consecutive day (where applicable). 7) Pre-Approval: Overtime must be pre-approved by manager in most departments. 8) Time Tracking: Use time clock or time entry system - accurate to 15-minute increments. 9) Holiday Pay: Separate from overtime (check holiday policy). 10) Comp Time: Not offered - overtime paid in cash. Questions on classification: hr@company.com.

question: What is the 401(k) matching policy?
answer: 401(k) Retirement Plan details: 1) Eligibility: All employees after 30 days of employment. 2) Company Match: 100% match on first 5% of salary you contribute (e.g., you contribute 5%  company adds 5% = 10% total). 3) Vesting: Company match vests 25% per year (fully vested after 4 years). Your contributions always 100% vested. 4) Contribution Limits 2024: $23,000 employee limit ($30,500 if age 50+). 5) Investment Options: 20+ mutual funds, target-date funds, brokerage window. 6) Enrollment: Log in to 401k.company.com or through benefits portal. 7) Changes: Adjust contribution percentage anytime, effective next pay period. 8) Auto-Increase: Optional 1% annual increase feature. 9) Roth 401(k): Available (post-tax contributions, tax-free withdrawals). 10) Loans: Available up to $50,000 or 50% of vested balance. Financial advisor available quarterly. Questions: 401k@company.com or 1-800-401K-HELP.

question: How does PTO accrual work?
answer: PTO (Paid Time Off) accrual: 1) Year 1: 15 days (120 hours). 2) Years 2-4: 18 days (144 hours). 3) Years 5-9: 21 days (168 hours). 4) Years 10+: 25 days (200 hours). 5) Accrual Method: Hours earned each pay period (e.g., 4.62 hours bi-weekly for 15 days/year). 6) Start Date: Accrual begins first day of employment. 7) First Use: Can use PTO after 90-day probation period. 8) Max Balance: 1.5x annual accrual (excess days paid out annually). 9) Carryover: Unused PTO carries to next year up to max balance. 10) Payout: Upon termination, unused PTO paid out (if state law requires or company policy). 11) Sick Leave: Separate bucket - 5 days/year, doesn't carry over. 12) Track Balance: Check current balance in payroll portal or time system. Questions: hr@company.com.

question: Am I eligible for parental leave?
answer: Parental Leave Policy: 1) Eligibility: All employees after 6 months of employment. 2) Primary Caregiver: 12 weeks paid leave (100% salary). 3) Secondary Caregiver: 4 weeks paid leave (100% salary). 4) Applies To: Birth, adoption, foster placement. 5) Timing: Must be taken within 12 months of child's arrival. 6) Can be Taken: Consecutively or split into 2 blocks with 30-day notice. 7) Additional Leave: Can combine with FMLA (up to 16 weeks total, additional time unpaid). 8) Benefits: Health insurance continues during leave. 9) Transition Back: Phased return option - part-time for 4 weeks at full-time pay. 10) Notification: Inform HR 30 days before due date/adoption. 11) Documentation: Birth certificate or adoption papers required. 12) Job Protection: Return to same or equivalent position. Contact HR at leave@company.com to start paperwork. Very generous compared to industry!

question: Can I make changes to my benefits outside of open enrollment?
answer: Mid-year benefits changes (Qualifying Life Events): 1) When Allowed: Only during annual open enrollment (November) OR within 31 days of qualifying life event (QLE). 2) Qualifying Events: Marriage, divorce, birth/adoption of child, loss of other coverage, spouse's job change, change in dependent status, significant cost change, relocation. 3) How to Make Changes: Log in to benefits portal within 31 days of QLE, select 'Life Event', upload documentation (marriage certificate, birth certificate, etc.). 4) Submit proof within 31 days or changes denied. 5) Effective Date: First of month following QLE or event date. 6) What Can Change: Add/remove dependents, change coverage level, switch plans. 7) Exception: FSA/HSA elections cannot be changed mid-year except for specific QLEs. 8) Declined QLE: If you miss 31-day window, must wait until next open enrollment. 9) Questions: benefits@company.com or ext. 2300. Important: Don't miss deadline - strictly enforced by insurance carriers!

question: What is the remote work policy?
answer: Remote/Hybrid Work Policy: 1) Standard Schedule: 3 days in office (typically Tue/Wed/Thu), 2 days remote (Mon/Fri). 2) Core Office Days: Wednesday ( team meeting day). 3) Flexibility: Managers may adjust schedule based on role requirements. 4) Fully Remote: Available for specific roles - requires VP approval and role must be suitable. 5) Requirements: Reliable high-speed internet (minimum 25 Mbps), dedicated workspace, available during work hours. 6) Equipment: Company provides laptop, monitor, keyboard, mouse - request additional equipment through IT. 7) Security: Must use VPN, encrypted devices, secure WiFi (no public WiFi for work). 8) Work Hours: Same as office hours - must be responsive during core hours 10am-3pm. 9) Meetings: Camera-on for team meetings. 10) International Remote: Not permitted due to tax/legal implications. 11) Temporary Remote: Can request full remote for 1-2 weeks (medical, family needs) with manager approval. Policy reviewed quarterly. Details: policies.company.com/remote-work.

question: How do I submit expense reports?
answer: Expense reporting process: 1) System: Use Concur app or expenses.company.com. 2) Eligible Expenses: Travel, meals (with clients), supplies, conference fees, professional development - must be business-related and pre-approved if over $500. 3) Submit Within: 30 days of expense date (required for reimbursement). 4) Required Info: Receipt/proof, business purpose, date, amount, attendees (for meals), project/client code. 5) Receipt Requirements: Must be itemized, over $25 requires receipt (under $25 needs explanation only). 6) Per Diem: $75/day meals when traveling (no receipts needed). 7) Mileage: IRS rate ($0.67/mile in 2024) for personal vehicle use. 8) Approval Flow: Manager  Finance (if over $1,000). 9) Reimbursement: Paid via direct deposit within 10 business days of approval. 10) Credit Card: Corporate Amex available for frequent travelers. 11) Non-reimbursable: Personal expenses, alcohol (unless client dinner), traffic tickets. Questions: expenses@company.com.

question: What is the code of conduct?
answer: Code of Conduct highlights: 1) Respect: Treat all colleagues, clients, partners with respect - zero tolerance for harassment, discrimination, bullying. 2) Integrity: Honest business practices, no conflicts of interest, protect confidential information. 3) Workplace: Professional behavior, appropriate dress code (business casual), punctuality. 4) Prohibited: Harassment, discrimination (based on race, gender, age, religion, disability, etc.), theft, violence, threats, substance abuse. 5) Confidentiality: Don't share company confidential info, client data, trade secrets - NDA in effect. 6) Social Media: Don't speak on behalf of company without authorization, be respectful online. 7) Gifts: Cannot accept gifts over $100 from vendors/clients. 8) Reporting Violations: Report to manager, HR, or anonymous ethics hotline 1-800-ETHICS-1 or ethics@company.com. 9) Non-Retaliation: Protected from retaliation for good-faith reporting. 10) Consequences: Violations may result in disciplinary action up to termination. Annual training required. Full code: policies.company.com/code-of-conduct.

question: Can I have a second job or freelance work?
answer: Outside Employment Policy: 1) Allowed: Yes, with conditions. 2) Disclosure Required: Must notify HR and get manager approval before starting. 3) Restrictions: Cannot compete with company, use company resources/time, conflict with schedule, involve company clients/confidential info. 4) Form: Complete 'Outside Employment Disclosure' form at hr.company.com. 5) Approval Process: Manager reviews for conflicts, HR approves within 5 business days. 6) Hours: Outside work cannot interfere with primary job performance or scheduled hours. 7) Intellectual Property: Any work created using company resources/time belongs to company. 8) Non-Compete: Review your employment agreement - some roles have non-compete clauses. 9) Moonlighting: Working late nights/weekends generally acceptable if performance not impacted. 10) Freelance/Consulting: Typically approved if different industry/no conflict. 11) Board Positions: Require VP-level approval. 12) Violation: Failure to disclose may result in termination. Questions: hr@company.com. Most requests approved if no direct competition.

question: What is the dress code?
answer: Dress Code Policy: 1) Standard: Business Casual daily. 2) Acceptable: Slacks, khakis, jeans (no rips/distressing), polo shirts, blouses, sweaters, closed-toe shoes, sneakers (clean). 3) Not Acceptable: Shorts, flip-flops, tank tops, graphic t-shirts (except company swag), athletic wear, revealing clothing, beach attire. 4) Client Meetings: Business Professional (suit/dress, dress shoes) - especially off-site meetings. 5) Casual Friday: Jeans and company t-shirts encouraged. 6) Summer: June-August more relaxed (clean shorts and sandals OK). 7) Remote Days: Whatever you want - but be camera-ready for video calls. 8) Department Variations: Tech/Creative teams more casual, Client-facing teams more formal. 9) Personal Expression: Tattoos, piercings, hair color welcome - be yourself! 10) Religious Accommodations: Granted for religious attire/head coverings. 11) Branded Gear: Company provides branded items quarterly - wearing encouraged but not required. Guideline: When in doubt, dress one level up. Questions: hr@company.com.

question: How do I request vacation time off?
answer: Vacation request process: 1) Check Balance: Log in to timeoff.company.com to view available PTO hours. 2) Submit Request: Select dates, enter reason/notes, submit at least 2 weeks in advance (1 month for extended leave 1+ weeks). 3) Manager Approval: Manager has 3 business days to approve/deny with reason. 4) Blackout Periods: Major project deadlines, year-end close (Dec 15-31), peak busy season - requests may be denied during these times. 5) First-Come, First-Served: If multiple team members request same dates, earliest request gets priority. 6) Coverage Plan: For absences 3+ days, create coverage plan (who handles your work). 7) Confirmation: You'll receive email confirmation once approved. 8) Cancellation: Can cancel up to 1 day before without penalty. 9) Calendar: Approved time off automatically syncs to Outlook/Google calendar. 10) Last-Minute: Requests under 2 weeks require manager phone approval, not guaranteed. Questions or urgent requests: your manager or timeoff@company.com. Pro tip: Request popular dates (summer, holidays) 2-3 months early!

question: What is the sick leave policy?
answer: Sick Leave Policy: 1) Accrual: 5 days (40 hours) per year for all full-time employees. 2) Part-Time: Pro-rated based on hours worked. 3) Use: For personal illness, injury, medical appointments, caring for sick family member. 4) No Carryover: Unused sick leave does NOT carry to next year (use it or lose it). 5) Call-In: Notify manager by 9 AM on day of absence (text/email/call). 6) Documentation: Doctor's note required for 3+ consecutive days. 7) Extended Illness: Beyond 5 days, can use PTO or apply for Short-Term Disability (after 7 days). 8) FMLA: Serious health conditions may qualify for FMLA (up to 12 weeks unpaid, job-protected). 9) Mental Health: Sick leave can be used for mental health days - encouraged! 10) Half Days: Can use in 4-hour increments. 11) Returning to Work: Must be symptom-free for 24 hours (especially contagious illness). 12) Work From Home: If you can work while mildly ill, discuss WFH option with manager instead of using sick leave. Questions: leave@company.com.

A: Sick Leave Policy: 1) Accrual: 5 days (40 hours) per year for all full-time employees. 2) Part-Time: Pro-rated based on hours worked. 3) Use: For personal illness, injury, medical appointments, caring for sick family member. 4) No Carryover: Unused sick leave does NOT carry to next year (use it or lose it). 5) Call-In: Notify manager by 9 AM on day of absence (text/email/call). 6) Documentation: Doctor's note required for 3+ consecutive days. 7) Extended Illness: Beyond 5 days, can use PTO or apply for Short-Term Disability (after 7 days). 8) FMLA: Serious health conditions may qualify for FMLA (up to 12 weeks unpaid, job-protected). 9) Mental Health: Sick leave can be used for mental health days - encouraged! 10) Half Days: Can use in 4-hour increments. 11) Returning to Work: Must be symptom-free for 24 hours (especially contagious illness). 12) Work From Home: If you can work while mildly ill, discuss WFH option with manager instead of using sick leave. Questions: leave@company.com.

question: What types of leave are available beyond vacation and sick?
answer: Additional leave types: 1) Parental Leave: 12 weeks paid (primary), 4 weeks (secondary) - see parental leave FAQ. 2) FMLA: 12 weeks unpaid, job-protected for serious health condition, bonding with newborn/adopted child, caring for family member (must have worked 12 months, 1,250 hours). 3) Bereavement: 5 days paid for immediate family (spouse, child, parent, sibling), 3 days for extended family (grandparent, in-law), additional unpaid time available. 4) Jury Duty: Fully paid - provide summons to HR, keep jury pay. 5) Military Leave: Paid for up to 2 weeks annual training, unpaid extended leave for deployment (USERRA protected). 6) Voting: 2 hours paid time off on Election Day if polls not open outside work hours. 7) Sabbatical: 4-week paid sabbatical after 7 years of service (must be used within 12 months). 8) Leave of Absence: Unpaid personal leave up to 3 months (manager/HR approval required, case-by-case). 9) Volunteer: 2 days paid volunteer leave per year. All leave types tracked in timeoff.company.com. Questions: leave@company.com or ext. 2350.

question: What happens to my unused PTO when I leave the company?
answer: PTO payout upon termination: 1) Accrued PTO: All unused, accrued PTO paid out in final paycheck. 2) Calculation: Based on current balance at termination date. 3) Pro-Rated: If terminated mid-accrual period, you receive pro-rated amount for time worked. 4) Negative Balance: If you used more PTO than accrued, amount deducted from final paycheck. 5) Final Paycheck Timing: Voluntary resignation - next regular pay date; Termination - within 3 business days; varies by state law. 6) Sick Leave: NOT paid out (sick leave doesn't accrue cash value). 7) Maximum: Payout capped at max accrual limit (1.5x annual accrual). 8) State Variations: Some states require payout, others don't - company policy is to pay out regardless. 9) Retirement: Same payout rules apply. 10) Unpaid Leave: If on unpaid leave at termination, PTO frozen at last worked date. Recommendation: Use PTO before leaving if possible (you control timing). Questions: payroll@company.com or hr@company.com.
text:
Q: What happens to my unused PTO when I leave the company?
A: PTO payout upon termination: 1) Accrued PTO: All unused, accrued PTO paid out in final paycheck. 2) Calculation: Based on current balance at termination date. 3) Pro-Rated: If terminated mid-accrual period, you receive pro-rated amount for time worked. 4) Negative Balance: If you used more PTO than accrued, amount deducted from final paycheck. 5) Final Paycheck Timing: Voluntary resignation - next regular pay date; Termination - within 3 business days; varies by state law. 6) Sick Leave: NOT paid out (sick leave doesn't accrue cash value). 7) Maximum: Payout capped at max accrual limit (1.5x annual accrual). 8) State Variations: Some states require payout, others don't - company policy is to pay out regardless. 9) Retirement: Same payout rules apply. 10) Unpaid Leave: If on unpaid leave at termination, PTO frozen at last worked date. Recommendation: Use PTO before leaving if possible (you control timing). Questions: payroll@company.com or hr@company.com.

question: Can I donate PTO to a coworker?
answer: PTO Donation Program: 1) Purpose: Help colleagues facing serious health/family emergencies who've exhausted their leave. 2) Eligibility to Receive: Employee experiencing catastrophic illness/injury (self or immediate family), exhausted all PTO and sick leave, in good standing. 3) Application: Employee or manager submits request to leave@company.com with medical documentation. 4) Eligibility to Donate: Any employee with PTO balance >40 hours can donate. 5) How to Donate: Visit timeoff.company.com > PTO Donation, select recipient, enter hours (minimum 8 hours). 6) Tax Implications: Donation not tax-deductible; recipient receives as taxable income. 7) Anonymity: Donations can be anonymous or attributed to you. 8) Matching: Company matches 50% of donated hours (up to 40 hours per recipient). 9) Maximum: Recipient can receive up to 160 hours through program. 10) Updates: HR sends anonymous updates on recipient's situation. Beautiful program - we support each other! Questions: leave@company.com.

question: How do I apply for FMLA leave?
answer: FMLA (Family and Medical Leave Act) process: 1) Eligibility: Worked for company 12+ months, 1,250+ hours in past 12 months. 2) Qualifying Reasons: Serious health condition (surgery, chronic illness, pregnancy), bonding with newborn/adopted child, caring for spouse/parent/child with serious condition, military family leave. 3) Duration: Up to 12 weeks in 12-month period (unpaid, job-protected). 4) Notice: Provide 30 days advance notice if foreseeable, or as soon as practicable for emergencies. 5) Application: Complete FMLA request form at leave.company.com or contact leave@company.com. 6) Medical Certification: Doctor completes certification form (Part B) - must return within 15 days. 7) Approval Process: HR reviews and notifies you within 5 days of determination. 8) Benefits: Health insurance continues (you pay employee portion), no PTO accrual during unpaid leave. 9) Intermittent Leave: Can take FMLA in blocks or reduced schedule if medically necessary. 10) Return: Same or equivalent position guaranteed. 11) Extensions: May request beyond 12 weeks as personal leave (not protected). Contact leave specialist at leave@company.com or ext. 2350.

Contact leave specialist at leave@company.com or ext. 2350.

question: When are performance reviews conducted?
answer: Performance Review Cycle: 1) Annual Reviews: Conducted in January for prior calendar year. 2) Mid-Year Check-In: July - informal progress discussion, no rating. 3) New Hires: 90-day review, then join regular annual cycle. 4) Timeline: Early January - self-assessment due; Mid-January - manager reviews; Late January - review meetings; Early February - ratings finalized, compensation adjustments effective. 5) Format: Written review + 1-on-1 meeting (60 minutes). 6) Rating Scale: 1 (Needs Improvement), 2 (Meets Expectations), 3 (Exceeds Expectations), 4 (Outstanding). 7) Components: Goal achievement, competencies, leadership/teamwork, areas for development. 8) Self-Assessment: Complete your self-review first (1-2 pages, specific examples). 9) 360 Feedback: Optional peer/subordinate feedback collected. 10) Compensation: Merit increases (0-5%) based on performance + company budget. 11) PIPs: Performance Improvement Plans for ratings of 1. Access review forms at performance.company.com. Questions: your manager or hr@company.com.

question: How do I set my annual goals?
answer: Goal Setting Process: 1) Timing: Set goals in January/February (aligned with performance cycle) and at start of new role. 2) Framework: Use SMART goals - Specific, Measurable, Achievable, Relevant, Time-bound. 3) Number: 3-5 major goals per year (too many dilutes focus). 4) Categories: Business/project outcomes (60%), skill development (25%), leadership/collaboration (15%). 5) Draft: Create initial goals, discuss with manager, refine together. 6) Documentation: Enter in performance.company.com by February 28th. 7) Alignment: Goals should support team/department/company objectives. 8) Examples: 'Launch Product X by Q3 with <5% bug rate', 'Complete Python certification by June', 'Mentor 2 junior developers through successful projects'. 9) Mid-Year Review: Revise goals in July if priorities shifted. 10) Tracking: Update progress quarterly in system, discuss in 1-on-1s. 11) Weightage: Can weight goals by importance (e.g., 40% Project A, 30% Project B, 30% Development). Year-end review evaluates against these goals. Pro tip: Include stretch goal (challenging but rewarding).

question: What are the promotion criteria?
answer: Promotion guidelines: 1) Eligibility: Minimum 18 months in current role (exceptions for exceptional performance). 2) Criteria: Consistently exceeds expectations (rating 3+), demonstrates next-level skills, business need for higher-level role exists, manager recommendation. 3) Timing: Promotions announced in February (with annual reviews) and August (mid-year cycle). 4) Process: Manager nominates  HR reviews  Department head approves  Compensation increase (typically 8-15%). 5) Levels: Individual Contributor track (Engineer 1-4, Senior, Staff, Principal) or Management track (Manager, Senior Manager, Director, VP). 6) Requirements: Document showing next-level impact, peer feedback, successful projects, mentor ship/leadership. 7) Application: Discuss with manager first, complete promotion packet at performance.company.com. 8) Timeline: Manager submits 6 weeks before promotion cycle, committee reviews 4 weeks, decision communicated 2 weeks later. 9) Feedback: If not promoted, receive specific development plan for next opportunity. 10) Self-Nomination: Allowed and encouraged! Promotion rate: ~20% annually. Be patient, build your case. Questions: hr@company.com.

question: How does the feedback culture work here?
answer: Feedback Culture: 1) Philosophy: Continuous feedback > Annual reviews. Feedback is a gift for growth. 2) Regular 1-on-1s: Bi-weekly 30-minute meetings with manager - discuss progress, challenges, feedback. 3) Real-Time Feedback: Encouraged immediately after events (good or developmental). 4) Method: Use SBI framework - Situation, Behavior, Impact. Example: 'In yesterday's client meeting (S), when you presented the data (B), it really built trust (I)'. 5) 360 Feedback: Can request peer feedback anytime via performance.company.com. 6) Receiving Feedback: Listen fully, ask clarifying questions, thank giver, reflect, create action plan. 7) Giving Feedback: Be specific, focus on behavior not person, balance positive and developmental, offer support. 8) Kudos System: Public recognition via Slack #kudos channel or kudos.company.com - great for celebrating wins! 9) Upward Feedback: Encouraged to provide feedback to managers - anonymous option available. 10) Feedback Training: 'Crucial Conversations' training for all employees. 11) Psychological Safety: No retaliation for honest, professional feedback. Culture builder: Make feedback regular, specific, and kind.

question: What happens if I'm placed on a Performance Improvement Plan?
answer: Performance Improvement Plan (PIP) process: 1) Reason: For performance consistently below expectations (rating of 1) or serious policy violation. 2) Not Punitive: Goal is to help you succeed, not push you out. Many employees successfully complete PIPs. 3) Duration: Typically 30-90 days depending on issues. 4) Components: Specific performance gaps identified, clear measurable goals, resources/support provided, weekly check-ins with manager, documentation of progress. 5) Meeting: Initial meeting with manager + HR to review PIP document, ask questions, align on expectations. 6) Support: May include training, mentoring, adjusted workload, coaching. 7) Weekly Reviews: Manager documents progress, provides feedback. 8) Outcomes: Successful completion (performance improves to acceptable level  stay in role), Partial improvement (PIP extended), Unsuccessful (may lead to termination). 9) Your Role: Take it seriously, ask for help, be proactive, document your efforts. 10) Fairness: You can appeal to HR if you feel PIP is unfair/discriminatory. 11) Future: Successful PIP completion doesn't affect future promotion/career. Fresh start! Questions: hr@company.com or your manager.

question: What is the onboarding process for new hires?
answer: New Hire Onboarding: Week 1 - Day 1: Welcome breakfast, badge/laptop setup (IT), benefits enrollment meeting, company overview presentation, office tour, team intros. Days 2-5: HR paperwork (I-9, W-4, direct deposit), IT training (systems access), safety training, role-specific training, lunch with team, buddy assigned. Week 2-4: Department onboarding, shadow team members, first projects assigned, 1-on-1s with cross-functional partners, product/service training. 30 Days: Check-in with manager and HR, feedback session, address questions. 60 Days: Mid-probation review, goal refinement. 90 Days: Official review, end of probation period. Throughout: Orientation checklist at onboarding.company.com to track completion. Onboarding buddy: Peer mentor for first 90 days. Welcome swag: Company t-shirt, mug, notebook. New Hire Cohort: Monthly cohort meetup with other new employees. Goal: Set you up for success! Questions anytime: onboarding@company.com or your manager.

question: How do I apply for an internal position?
answer: To apply for internal positions: 1) Visit the internal job portal at careers.company.com/internal. 2) Log in with your employee credentials. 3) Browse open positions or search by department/keyword. 4) Click 'Apply' on positions of interest. 5) Update your internal resume if needed. 6) Complete the application form and submit. 7) Notify your current manager (required after submitting). 8) HR will review within 5 business days. 9) You must have been in current role for at least 12 months. 10) Internal candidates receive priority consideration and interview feedback within 2 weeks.

question: What is the typical interview process timeline?
answer: Our interview process typically follows this timeline: 1) Application Review: 3-5 business days. 2) Phone Screen: 30 minutes with HR recruiter, scheduled within 1 week. 3) Technical/Skills Assessment: 1-2 hours, completed within 1 week. 4) First Round Interview: 1 hour with hiring manager, within 1-2 weeks. 5) Second Round: Panel interview with team members (1-2 hours), within 1 week. 6) Final Interview: 30-45 minutes with department head. 7) Offer Decision: 3-5 business days after final interview. Total timeline: 3-6 weeks from application to offer. We provide updates at each stage.

question: What are the candidate screening criteria?
answer: We evaluate candidates on: 1) Required Qualifications: Education, certifications, years of experience as listed in job description. 2) Skills Match: Technical skills, software proficiency, industry knowledge (must meet 80%+ of requirements). 3) Cultural Fit: Alignment with company values, teamwork, communication skills. 4) Portfolio/Work Samples: For applicable roles. 5) References: Professional references (minimum 2). 6) Background Check: Conducted after conditional offer. 7) Assessment Scores: Technical tests, personality assessments where applicable. Priority given to: internal candidates, employee referrals, diverse candidates. All candidates receive equal consideration regardless of age, gender, race, or background.

Priority given to: internal candidates, employee referrals, diverse candidates. All candidates receive equal consideration regardless of age, gender, race, or background.

question: Can I refer someone for a position?
answer: Yes! Our employee referral program: 1) Log in to careers.company.com/referral. 2) Enter referral's name, email, and position they're suited for. 3) Add a brief recommendation (why they're a good fit). 4) Referral receives priority screening. 5) You'll be notified at each stage of their application. 6) Referral Bonus: $2,000 for most positions (paid after 90 days of employment), $5,000 for hard-to-fill senior roles. 7) Referrals hired have 25% higher retention rate. 8) No limit on number of referrals. 9) Cannot refer immediate family members. 10) Track your referrals in the portal dashboard.

question: What happens after I receive a job offer?
answer: After receiving an offer: 1) Offer Letter: Contains position details, salary, start date, benefits summary. 2) Response Deadline: You have 5 business days to accept, decline, or negotiate. 3) Negotiation: You may discuss salary, start date, or benefits with HR. 4) Acceptance: Sign and return offer letter via DocuSign. 5) Background Check: Completed within 3-5 days (employment verification, criminal check, education verification). 6) Pre-boarding: Receive welcome packet, IT setup form, and first-day details. 7) Onboarding Documents: I-9, W-4, direct deposit, benefits enrollment (complete before start date). 8) Start Date: Typically 2-4 weeks from offer acceptance. Offer contingent on successful background check and reference verification.

question: Do you sponsor work visas?
answer: Visa sponsorship policy: 1) H-1B Visa: Yes, we sponsor for specialized positions requiring bachelor's degree or higher. 2) Eligible Roles: Engineering, IT, Finance, specialized professional roles. 3) Requirements: Position must meet prevailing wage requirements, candidate must have qualifying degree/experience. 4) Process: Candidate must be available to start work authorization process, lottery-based (filing in March). 5) Other Visas: We support OPT, OPT STEM extensions, and green card sponsorship for long-term employees. 6) Transfer H-1B: We accept transfers if you currently have valid H-1B with another employer. 7) Timeline: 3-6 months for H-1B processing. 8) Cost: Company covers legal and filing fees. Contact immigration@company.com for specific questions. Not all positions eligible.

question: When is payday?
answer: Payroll schedule: 1) Pay Frequency: Bi-weekly (every other Friday). 2) Total Pay Periods: 26 per year. 3) Direct Deposit: Funds available by 9 AM EST on payday. 4) Paper Check: Available for pickup after 12 PM (must opt-in via Payroll portal). 5) Pay Period: Covers previous 2 weeks (Monday-Sunday). 6) First Paycheck: May be prorated based on start date, typically 2-3 weeks after hire. 7) Holidays: If payday falls on holiday, payment made on last business day before. 8) View Pay Schedule: Check payroll.company.com for full year calendar. 9) Time Entry Deadline: Submit time by Tuesday 5 PM for current pay period. 10) Questions: Contact payroll@company.com or call ext. 2200.

question: How do I read my pay slip?
answer: Understanding your pay slip: 1) Gross Pay: Total earnings before deductions (regular hours + overtime + bonuses). 2) Federal Income Tax: Based on W-4 withholdings. 3) State Income Tax: Based on state residency. 4) FICA: Social Security (6.2%) + Medicare (1.45%). 5) Retirement: 401(k) contributions (pre-tax). 6) Health Insurance: Medical, dental, vision premiums (pre-tax). 7) Other Deductions: FSA, HSA, life insurance, disability. 8) Net Pay: Take-home amount after all deductions. 9) YTD Columns: Year-to-date totals for tax purposes. 10) PTO Balance: Current vacation/sick leave available. Access detailed breakdown at payroll.company.com. Download pay stubs anytime. Questions? Contact payroll@company.com.

question: How do I update my tax withholdings?
answer: To change tax withholdings: 1) Log in to payroll.company.com. 2) Go to 'Tax Information' section. 3) Click 'Update W-4'. 4) Complete new IRS W-4 form online. 5) Adjust: Filing status, dependents, additional withholding amount. 6) Submit electronically. 7) Changes effective next pay period (2 weeks). 8) Verify changes on next pay stub. 9) Update state withholdings separately if applicable. 10) Use IRS Withholding Calculator at irs.gov/w4app to determine correct withholdings. Important: Update after life changes (marriage, children, second job). Too little withheld = tax owed in April. Too much = smaller paycheck but refund later. Contact payroll for questions.

question: When will I receive my W-2 form?
answer: W-2 distribution: 1) Mailing Date: January 31st each year (federal deadline). 2) Electronic W-2: Available in payroll portal by January 25th. 3) Paper W-2: Mailed to address on file, allow 7-10 business days for delivery. 4) Opt-In to Electronic: Go to payroll.company.com > Tax Documents > E-Delivery Consent. 5) Update Address: Ensure correct address by December 31st for timely delivery. 6) Lost W-2: Request reprint after February 15th if not received. 7) Reprint Fee: $15 for paper copy, free electronic copy. 8) Former Employees: Mailed to last known address. Update address at payroll@company.com. 9) Access: W-2s available in portal for 7 years. 10) Questions: Contact payroll@company.com after February 1st.

question: How do I set up or change direct deposit?
answer: Direct deposit setup/changes: 1) Log in to payroll.company.com. 2) Navigate to 'Direct Deposit' section. 3) Click 'Add Bank Account'. 4) Enter: Bank name, routing number (9 digits), account number, account type (checking/savings). 5) Upload voided check or bank letter for verification. 6) Verify with micro-deposits (2 small deposits within 2-3 business days). 7) Once verified, set as primary account. 8) Split Deposits: Allocate percentage or fixed amount to multiple accounts (up to 3). 9) Changes effective 2 pay periods after verification. 10) Your last paycheck to old method, then switches. Keep old account open through transition. Paper check available if needed during setup. Questions: payroll@company.com or ext. 2200.

question: What should I do if my paycheck is incorrect?
answer: If you notice payroll errors: 1) Act Quickly: Report within 5 business days of payday. 2) Contact Payroll: Email payroll@company.com with: your employee ID, pay period dates, specific discrepancy description, correct amount. 3) Common Errors: Missing hours, incorrect overtime calculation, wrong deduction amounts, missing bonus/commission. 4) Documentation: Attach time sheets, overtime approvals, or relevant emails. 5) Investigation: Payroll investigates within 2 business days. 6) Correction: If error confirmed, adjustment made on next regular paycheck or special check issued if over $500. 7) Off-Cycle Check: For large errors affecting bills, request emergency payment (requires manager approval). 8) Underpayment: Corrected with interest if company error. 9) Overpayment: Repayment plan established if amount is significant. Always verify each pay stub carefully.

question: How is overtime calculated?
answer: Overtime calculation policy: 1) Eligibility: Non-exempt employees (hourly workers) - exempt employees (salaried) not eligible. 2) Overtime Rate: 1.5x regular hourly rate. 3) Threshold: Hours worked over 40 in a workweek (Sunday-Saturday). 4) Example: Regular rate $20/hr  Overtime rate $30/hr. 5) Daily Overtime: Some states require OT after 8 hours/day - check your state. 6) Double Time: 2x rate for work over 12 hours in a day or 7th consecutive day (where applicable). 7) Pre-Approval: Overtime must be pre-approved by manager in most departments. 8) Time Tracking: Use time clock or time entry system - accurate to 15-minute increments. 9) Holiday Pay: Separate from overtime (check holiday policy). 10) Comp Time: Not offered - overtime paid in cash. Questions on classification: hr@company.com.

Missing deadline = wait until next open enrollment (November).

question: What is the 401(k) matching policy?
answer: 401(k) Retirement Plan details: 1) Eligibility: All employees after 30 days of employment. 2) Company Match: 100% match on first 5% of salary you contribute (e.g., you contribute 5%  company adds 5% = 10% total). 3) Vesting: Company match vests 25% per year (fully vested after 4 years). Your contributions always 100% vested. 4) Contribution Limits 2024: $23,000 employee limit ($30,500 if age 50+). 5) Investment Options: 20+ mutual funds, target-date funds, brokerage window. 6) Enrollment: Log in to 401k.company.com or through benefits portal. 7) Changes: Adjust contribution percentage anytime, effective next pay period. 8) Auto-Increase: Optional 1% annual increase feature. 9) Roth 401(k): Available (post-tax contributions, tax-free withdrawals). 10) Loans: Available up to $50,000 or 50% of vested balance. Financial advisor available quarterly. Questions: 401k@company.com or 1-800-401K-HELP.

question: How does PTO accrual work?
answer: PTO (Paid Time Off) accrual: 1) Year 1: 15 days (120 hours). 2) Years 2-4: 18 days (144 hours). 3) Years 5-9: 21 days (168 hours). 4) Years 10+: 25 days (200 hours). 5) Accrual Method: Hours earned each pay period (e.g., 4.62 hours bi-weekly for 15 days/year). 6) Start Date: Accrual begins first day of employment. 7) First Use: Can use PTO after 90-day probation period. 8) Max Balance: 1.5x annual accrual (excess days paid out annually). 9) Carryover: Unused PTO carries to next year up to max balance. 10) Payout: Upon termination, unused PTO paid out (if state law requires or company policy). 11) Sick Leave: Separate bucket - 5 days/year, doesn't carry over. 12) Track Balance: Check current balance in payroll portal or time system. Questions: hr@company.com.

question: Am I eligible for parental leave?
answer: Parental Leave Policy: 1) Eligibility: All employees after 6 months of employment. 2) Primary Caregiver: 12 weeks paid leave (100% salary). 3) Secondary Caregiver: 4 weeks paid leave (100% salary). 4) Applies To: Birth, adoption, foster placement. 5) Timing: Must be taken within 12 months of child's arrival. 6) Can be Taken: Consecutively or split into 2 blocks with 30-day notice. 7) Additional Leave: Can combine with FMLA (up to 16 weeks total, additional time unpaid). 8) Benefits: Health insurance continues during leave. 9) Transition Back: Phased return option - part-time for 4 weeks at full-time pay. 10) Notification: Inform HR 30 days before due date/adoption. 11) Documentation: Birth certificate or adoption papers required. 12) Job Protection: Return to same or equivalent position. Contact HR at leave@company.com to start paperwork. Very generous compared to industry!

question: Can I make changes to my benefits outside of open enrollment?
answer: Mid-year benefits changes (Qualifying Life Events): 1) When Allowed: Only during annual open enrollment (November) OR within 31 days of qualifying life event (QLE). 2) Qualifying Events: Marriage, divorce, birth/adoption of child, loss of other coverage, spouse's job change, change in dependent status, significant cost change, relocation. 3) How to Make Changes: Log in to benefits portal within 31 days of QLE, select 'Life Event', upload documentation (marriage certificate, birth certificate, etc.). 4) Submit proof within 31 days or changes denied. 5) Effective Date: First of month following QLE or event date. 6) What Can Change: Add/remove dependents, change coverage level, switch plans. 7) Exception: FSA/HSA elections cannot be changed mid-year except for specific QLEs. 8) Declined QLE: If you miss 31-day window, must wait until next open enrollment. 9) Questions: benefits@company.com or ext. 2300. Important: Don't miss deadline - strictly enforced by insurance carriers!

question: What is the remote work policy?
answer: Remote/Hybrid Work Policy: 1) Standard Schedule: 3 days in office (typically Tue/Wed/Thu), 2 days remote (Mon/Fri). 2) Core Office Days: Wednesday ( team meeting day). 3) Flexibility: Managers may adjust schedule based on role requirements. 4) Fully Remote: Available for specific roles - requires VP approval and role must be suitable. 5) Requirements: Reliable high-speed internet (minimum 25 Mbps), dedicated workspace, available during work hours. 6) Equipment: Company provides laptop, monitor, keyboard, mouse - request additional equipment through IT. 7) Security: Must use VPN, encrypted devices, secure WiFi (no public WiFi for work). 8) Work Hours: Same as office hours - must be responsive during core hours 10am-3pm. 9) Meetings: Camera-on for team meetings. 10) International Remote: Not permitted due to tax/legal implications. 11) Temporary Remote: Can request full remote for 1-2 weeks (medical, family needs) with manager approval. Policy reviewed quarterly. Details: policies.company.com/remote-work.
text:
Q: What is the remote work policy?
A: Remote/Hybrid Work Policy: 1) Standard Schedule: 3 days in office (typically Tue/Wed/Thu), 2 days remote (Mon/Fri). 2) Core Office Days: Wednesday ( team meeting day). 3) Flexibility: Managers may adjust schedule based on role requirements. 4) Fully Remote: Available for specific roles - requires VP approval and role must be suitable. 5) Requirements: Reliable high-speed internet (minimum 25 Mbps), dedicated workspace, available during work hours. 6) Equipment: Company provides laptop, monitor, keyboard, mouse - request additional equipment through IT. 7) Security: Must use VPN, encrypted devices, secure WiFi (no public WiFi for work). 8) Work Hours: Same as office hours - must be responsive during core hours 10am-3pm. 9) Meetings: Camera-on for team meetings. 10) International Remote: Not permitted due to tax/legal implications. 11) Temporary Remote: Can request full remote for 1-2 weeks (medical, family needs) with manager approval. Policy reviewed quarterly. Details: policies.company.com/remote-work.

question: How do I submit expense reports?
answer: Expense reporting process: 1) System: Use Concur app or expenses.company.com. 2) Eligible Expenses: Travel, meals (with clients), supplies, conference fees, professional development - must be business-related and pre-approved if over $500. 3) Submit Within: 30 days of expense date (required for reimbursement). 4) Required Info: Receipt/proof, business purpose, date, amount, attendees (for meals), project/client code. 5) Receipt Requirements: Must be itemized, over $25 requires receipt (under $25 needs explanation only). 6) Per Diem: $75/day meals when traveling (no receipts needed). 7) Mileage: IRS rate ($0.67/mile in 2024) for personal vehicle use. 8) Approval Flow: Manager  Finance (if over $1,000). 9) Reimbursement: Paid via direct deposit within 10 business days of approval. 10) Credit Card: Corporate Amex available for frequent travelers. 11) Non-reimbursable: Personal expenses, alcohol (unless client dinner), traffic tickets. Questions: expenses@company.com.

question: What is the code of conduct?
answer: Code of Conduct highlights: 1) Respect: Treat all colleagues, clients, partners with respect - zero tolerance for harassment, discrimination, bullying. 2) Integrity: Honest business practices, no conflicts of interest, protect confidential information. 3) Workplace: Professional behavior, appropriate dress code (business casual), punctuality. 4) Prohibited: Harassment, discrimination (based on race, gender, age, religion, disability, etc.), theft, violence, threats, substance abuse. 5) Confidentiality: Don't share company confidential info, client data, trade secrets - NDA in effect. 6) Social Media: Don't speak on behalf of company without authorization, be respectful online. 7) Gifts: Cannot accept gifts over $100 from vendors/clients. 8) Reporting Violations: Report to manager, HR, or anonymous ethics hotline 1-800-ETHICS-1 or ethics@company.com. 9) Non-Retaliation: Protected from retaliation for good-faith reporting. 10) Consequences: Violations may result in disciplinary action up to termination. Annual training required. Full code: policies.company.com/code-of-conduct.

question: Can I have a second job or freelance work?
answer: Outside Employment Policy: 1) Allowed: Yes, with conditions. 2) Disclosure Required: Must notify HR and get manager approval before starting. 3) Restrictions: Cannot compete with company, use company resources/time, conflict with schedule, involve company clients/confidential info. 4) Form: Complete 'Outside Employment Disclosure' form at hr.company.com. 5) Approval Process: Manager reviews for conflicts, HR approves within 5 business days. 6) Hours: Outside work cannot interfere with primary job performance or scheduled hours. 7) Intellectual Property: Any work created using company resources/time belongs to company. 8) Non-Compete: Review your employment agreement - some roles have non-compete clauses. 9) Moonlighting: Working late nights/weekends generally acceptable if performance not impacted. 10) Freelance/Consulting: Typically approved if different industry/no conflict. 11) Board Positions: Require VP-level approval. 12) Violation: Failure to disclose may result in termination. Questions: hr@company.com. Most requests approved if no direct competition.

question: What is the dress code?
answer: Dress Code Policy: 1) Standard: Business Casual daily. 2) Acceptable: Slacks, khakis, jeans (no rips/distressing), polo shirts, blouses, sweaters, closed-toe shoes, sneakers (clean). 3) Not Acceptable: Shorts, flip-flops, tank tops, graphic t-shirts (except company swag), athletic wear, revealing clothing, beach attire. 4) Client Meetings: Business Professional (suit/dress, dress shoes) - especially off-site meetings. 5) Casual Friday: Jeans and company t-shirts encouraged. 6) Summer: June-August more relaxed (clean shorts and sandals OK). 7) Remote Days: Whatever you want - but be camera-ready for video calls. 8) Department Variations: Tech/Creative teams more casual, Client-facing teams more formal. 9) Personal Expression: Tattoos, piercings, hair color welcome - be yourself! 10) Religious Accommodations: Granted for religious attire/head coverings. 11) Branded Gear: Company provides branded items quarterly - wearing encouraged but not required. Guideline: When in doubt, dress one level up. Questions: hr@company.com.

question: How do I request vacation time off?
answer: Vacation request process: 1) Check Balance: Log in to timeoff.company.com to view available PTO hours. 2) Submit Request: Select dates, enter reason/notes, submit at least 2 weeks in advance (1 month for extended leave 1+ weeks). 3) Manager Approval: Manager has 3 business days to approve/deny with reason. 4) Blackout Periods: Major project deadlines, year-end close (Dec 15-31), peak busy season - requests may be denied during these times. 5) First-Come, First-Served: If multiple team members request same dates, earliest request gets priority. 6) Coverage Plan: For absences 3+ days, create coverage plan (who handles your work). 7) Confirmation: You'll receive email confirmation once approved. 8) Cancellation: Can cancel up to 1 day before without penalty. 9) Calendar: Approved time off automatically syncs to Outlook/Google calendar. 10) Last-Minute: Requests under 2 weeks require manager phone approval, not guaranteed. Questions or urgent requests: your manager or timeoff@company.com. Pro tip: Request popular dates (summer, holidays) 2-3 months early!

question: What is the sick leave policy?
answer: Sick Leave Policy: 1) Accrual: 5 days (40 hours) per year for all full-time employees. 2) Part-Time: Pro-rated based on hours worked. 3) Use: For personal illness, injury, medical appointments, caring for sick family member. 4) No Carryover: Unused sick leave does NOT carry to next year (use it or lose it). 5) Call-In: Notify manager by 9 AM on day of absence (text/email/call). 6) Documentation: Doctor's note required for 3+ consecutive days. 7) Extended Illness: Beyond 5 days, can use PTO or apply for Short-Term Disability (after 7 days). 8) FMLA: Serious health conditions may qualify for FMLA (up to 12 weeks unpaid, job-protected). 9) Mental Health: Sick leave can be used for mental health days - encouraged! 10) Half Days: Can use in 4-hour increments. 11) Returning to Work: Must be symptom-free for 24 hours (especially contagious illness). 12) Work From Home: If you can work while mildly ill, discuss WFH option with manager instead of using sick leave. Questions: leave@company.com.

Questions: leave@company.com.

question: What types of leave are available beyond vacation and sick?
answer: Additional leave types: 1) Parental Leave: 12 weeks paid (primary), 4 weeks (secondary) - see parental leave FAQ. 2) FMLA: 12 weeks unpaid, job-protected for serious health condition, bonding with newborn/adopted child, caring for family member (must have worked 12 months, 1,250 hours). 3) Bereavement: 5 days paid for immediate family (spouse, child, parent, sibling), 3 days for extended family (grandparent, in-law), additional unpaid time available. 4) Jury Duty: Fully paid - provide summons to HR, keep jury pay. 5) Military Leave: Paid for up to 2 weeks annual training, unpaid extended leave for deployment (USERRA protected). 6) Voting: 2 hours paid time off on Election Day if polls not open outside work hours. 7) Sabbatical: 4-week paid sabbatical after 7 years of service (must be used within 12 months). 8) Leave of Absence: Unpaid personal leave up to 3 months (manager/HR approval required, case-by-case). 9) Volunteer: 2 days paid volunteer leave per year. All leave types tracked in timeoff.company.com. Questions: leave@company.com or ext. 2350.

question: What happens to my unused PTO when I leave the company?
answer: PTO payout upon termination: 1) Accrued PTO: All unused, accrued PTO paid out in final paycheck. 2) Calculation: Based on current balance at termination date. 3) Pro-Rated: If terminated mid-accrual period, you receive pro-rated amount for time worked. 4) Negative Balance: If you used more PTO than accrued, amount deducted from final paycheck. 5) Final Paycheck Timing: Voluntary resignation - next regular pay date; Termination - within 3 business days; varies by state law. 6) Sick Leave: NOT paid out (sick leave doesn't accrue cash value). 7) Maximum: Payout capped at max accrual limit (1.5x annual accrual). 8) State Variations: Some states require payout, others don't - company policy is to pay out regardless. 9) Retirement: Same payout rules apply. 10) Unpaid Leave: If on unpaid leave at termination, PTO frozen at last worked date. Recommendation: Use PTO before leaving if possible (you control timing). Questions: payroll@company.com or hr@company.com.
